wikipedia_page.main: Major General Lord Michael Fitzalan-Howard,  (22 October 1916 – 2 November 2007) was a senior officer in the British Army. He later served as Marshal of the Diplomatic Corps in the British Royal Household for ten years until 1982, and Gold Stick-in-Waiting and Colonel of the Life Guards for 20 years, finally retiring in 1999.

response: *Major-General Lord Michael Fitzalan-Howard,  1968–1971 late Life Guards
